dmca.title: DMCA Takedown Notice (VideoCodeZone.com)
dmca.body:
_____ From: jay@intermediamail.com [mailto:jay@intermediamail.com] Sent: Monday, May 09, 2005 2:06 PM To: copyright@theplanet.com Subject: DMCA Takedown Notice (VideoCodeZone.com) Sender Information: (Complaining Party) Music Video Net Inc. 229 Bay Blvd Bayville, NJ 08721 (732) 269.1908 Recipient Information: videocodezone.com Registrant: Host Master 13089 Peyton Drive #C-231 Chino Hills, California 91709 United States Sent via: email Re: videocodezone.com Property Rights - Notice and Takedown request under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, Section 512(c)(3) Dear Sir or Madam, I am the President for and write on behalf of Music Video Net Inc. and their website MusicVideoCodes.com. We have recently learned that a website you are directly or indirectly hosting on your servers, videocodezone.com, is violating Music Video Net's website MusicVideoCodes.com copyrights, pending trademark, and patent pending marks. Our original copyrighted material can be found here: http://www.musicvideocodes.com Also, our Patent Pending application number 60/666614 is being violated. Pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act ("DMCA"), we are writing to provide you notice of the website you are hosting which is conducting illegal activities and copyright infringement. Acting as an agent on behalf of Music Video Net Inc. and MusicVideoCodes.com, I have a good faith belief that the use of musicvideocodes.com's copyrighted material in this manner is not authorized by us, our agent, or the law. videocodezone.com Is hosted by your services per their IP Address (67.19.210.162) http://www.dnsreport.com/tools/dnsreport.ch?domain=videocodezone.com Which is hosted by: http://www.dnsstuff.com/tools/whois.ch?ip=67.19.210.162 The organization you are hosting (videocodezone.com) conduct constitutes willful copyright infringement and unfair competition and is damaging Music Video Net Inc.'s, MusicVideoCodes.com, our customers and our advertisers. Music Video Net Inc.'s and MusicVideoCodes.com hereby asking that you remove all content and services, and materials from your servers that was copied from MusicVideoCodes.com. We insist that you confirm that your client has ceased all acts of infringement and destroyed all infringing materials within 5 days' of your receipt of this letter. Furthermore, Music Video Net Inc. and MusicVideoCodes.com has a pending trademark with the USPTO for the registered mark "Music Video Code(s)" (the "Mark"), which has been in continuous use in interstate commerce since the world-renowned website entitled "MusicVideoCodes.com" was first published in 2004. Music Video Net Inc. is the exclusive licensee of the publishing and merchandising rights to the Mark in connection with the internet and all related collateral products and services (collectively, the "Music Video Codes Properties"). As I am sure you are aware, MusicVideoCodes.com is quite probably the most famous website ever published in conjuction with providing Music Video Codes (a term and service which we have created) to bloggers and profile users. MusicVideoCodes.com is ranked 6th in visitor traffic by Nielsen//NetRatings http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr/charts/internet/music.jsp Indeed, millions of pageviews of the various music videos on the website have taken place since first publication. As a result of this enormous number of pageviews and the attendant publicity, the public associates the Mark and its distinctive logo solely with Music Video Net Inc. and MusicVideoCodes.com. It has come to our attention that videocodezone.com has been using our pending trademark, "Music Video Code(s)", throughout their website to promote our patent pending service, which provides users with "Music Video Codes" to display on their blogs or profiles. We continue to be very concerned about their use of our pending trademark and pending patent as it constitutes an improper association, which trades on the goodwill and reputation of Music Video Net Inc. and is likely to cause confusion with those Properties and applicable federal and local laws. As it is our obligation to protect our intellectual property rights, we must request that your clicent cease all use of the our patent pending service of providing "Music Video Codes" for users to display on their blogs or profiles, or any confusingly similar properties in connection with your website or otherwise, and that you refrain from registering any confusingly similar domains, products, or services in the future. In specific, videocodezone.com has copied our actual HTML Code from our page to give visitors to their website which is to be used to embed a music video onto the visitor's blog or website pages (this actual HTML CODE is detailed in our patent pending documents): Original Material Found On: http://www.musicvideocodes.com/?song=1863 Found on every song page of our site below each music video in the HTML Code box. Original Material which is included in our patent pending is:
>
Video code provided by >Music Video Codes The Infringing Work: Found On: http://videocodezone.com/ (Click on the URL 'badfish') Also, every link in the center content area of their site is hyperlinked to javascript to display our original work in the square boxes to the right.
Music Video Codes By VideoCodeZone *Please Note* The website VideoCodeZone.com is running a script for the links on this page. Their infringing work is the actual HTML Code itself, and they have replaced some text here and their in attempts to try and customize the code to work in their favor for self-promotion. Also, they are hotlinking files from our website without our permission: src='http://x2.musicvideocodes.com/44//7309292372.asf' We hope that you do not require that we list every single page that they are infringing and hotlinking to as the list covers over 3,000 pages whicih are templated pages using javascript to recover each infringement by clicking on the URL's that are in the center of each of their infringing pages. We trust that you understand Music Video Net Inc. and MusicVideoCodes.com's concern over the infringement of their rights and that you will fully cooperate with us and confirm your compliance with our requests within 5 days' of your receipt of this letter. The foregoing is without waiver of any and all rights of Music Video Net Inc.'s or MusicVideoCodes.com, all of which are expressly reserved herein. I declare, under penalty of perjury, that the above is accurate, that Music Video Net Inc. and MusicVideoCodes.com are the intellectual property (copyright, trademark, and patent pending) owners of our material and that I am authorized to act on behalf of Music Video Net Inc. and MusicVideoCodes.com. Very truly yours, Jason Gould President, Music Video Net Inc.
